channel.title: meta on TIL | Front-end web development | Neil Magee
channel.description: Recent content in meta on TIL | Front-end web development | Neil Magee

item.title: Subtle art of performance wins
item.description: Today I learned more about the subtle art of javascript performance. I have been doing a few algorithm challenges on freeCodeCamp, which is a great resource. Whilst completing one titled “Intermediate Algorithm Scripting: Smallest Common Multiple” I had a look at what other solutions people had posted, and how they compared to mine. A user had put together a CodePen running BenchmarkJS that contained about four solutions. I added my solution (below) to the benchmark test and the results were surprising.

item.title: Declarative vs. Imperative programming
item.description:
Today I learned more about the distinction between declarative and imperative programming. I have seen the terms used in various places, but I could not give a good explanation about what they mean. So with a bit of curiosity and I thought that I would get a better handle on the definition.

Imperative programming is like how you do something, and declarative programming is more like what you do.

item.title: Authentication vs. Authorisation
item.description: Today I learned more about the distinction between authentication and authorisation. I have probably thought of those terms as being synonymous with eachother and fulfilling the same needs. But I was wrong.
